section.title: like doing and would like to do
section.sectiontitle: We use like + plural noun or like + -ing form to talk about things that we enjoy.
section.sectiontitle2: We use would like + noun or would like + infinitive with to to talk about things we want. Would like is more polite than want.
section.text3: I would like an egg sandwich, please.
section.text4a: I'd like to speak to the manager, please.

section.title: like doing and would like to do
section.sectiontitle: In the question, we use would + subject + like ...
section.text1: Mia would like to see the elephants at the zoo.
section.text1a: Would she like to see the elephants first? Yes, she would.
section.sectiontitle2: When we make an offer, there are different answers possible.
section.text3a: Yes, please or I'd love one or Yes, I would.
section.text4: Would you like to come out to dinner?
